cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ENE of Guantanamo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest through the Bahamas and forecast to turn northwest, skirting the Florida east coast and then paralleling the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east coast (likely near the North Palm Beach–Sebastian Inlet area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Sebastian Inlet FL to Flagler/Volusia county line FL (does not yet include GA)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Golden Beach FL to Sebastian Inlet FL and Lake Okeechobee; Tropical-storm warnings Keys to Chokoloskee FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from Florida through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) are increasingly likely; brief hurricane-force gusts are possible if the core tracks very near the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 3–5 ft of surge onto low-lying parts of the Georgia barrier islands, including areas near Brunswick.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rain bands associated with Matthew could drop 4–6+ inches, producing flash-flood potential in coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents; possible port channel shoaling due to wave action.
